column4: how can I find xmule/amule to install it? Tried with Adept, but no X.AMULE
you need universe repos to be enabled for xmule
how can I do that, please?
right 2 options. First follow instructions on this link (need to correct non-free): http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Dapper#How_to_add_extra_repositories
/etc/apt/sources.list
what can I do with this etc/apt..?
either go into adept and go to Adept Menu -> Manage Repositories or edit it using an editor e.g. sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list, but if you edit it, back it up first
I've already tried to done that, but I dion't have gedit.
using gnome or kde?
kde.
Run Command... kdesu kate /etc/apt/sources.list (have you backed this file up? )
how can I do it?
done it ! I mean ... I've already typed the command you said ... kdesu kate ...
now? :)
have you backed the file up?
YES !
follow the rest of the instructions here (BTW PLF repos need correcting) http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Dapper#How_to_add_extra_repositories
change line deb http://packages.freecontrib.org/plf dapper free non-free
to deb http://packages.freecontrib.org/ubuntu/plf dapper free non-free
change line deb-src http://packages.freecontrib.org/plf dapper free non-free
to deb-src http://packages.freecontrib.org/ubuntu/plf dapper free non-free
not asking you for a password?
asked me for a password ... got it right and ... the same read only mode. :(
